name: Hill Repeats
description: Running uphill intervals that build leg strength, power, and running economy. One of the most effective workouts for improving speed and preventing injury.

exercises.name: Short Hill Sprints (8 x 30s)
exercises.description: Maximum effort hill sprints for explosive power
exercises.instructions: Find a steep hill. 10min easy warmup. Then 8 rounds of: 30s maximum effort uphill sprint, walk/jog down for full recovery (2-3min). 5min cooldown.

conditions.calf_moderate: Reduce to 6 reps, focus on shorter ground contact time

exercises.hillGuidance: Hill should be steep enough that you can't sprint at full speed - about 6-8% gradient ideal. Focus on powerful knee drive and forward lean.

exercises.name: Medium Hill Repeats (6 x 90s)
exercises.description: Classic hill workout for strength endurance
exercises.instructions: 10min easy warmup. Then 6 rounds of: 90s hard effort uphill, jog/walk down slowly for full recovery (3-4min). 5min cooldown.

conditions.knee_moderate: Choose gradual hill (4-5% gradient), reduce to 5 reps
conditions.calf_moderate: 6 x 60s instead, warm up calves thoroughly

exercises.hillGuidance: Effort should be 85-90% max. Moderate gradient (5-6%). Focus on maintaining form - don't let hips drop backward.

exercises.name: Long Hill Repeats (4 x 3min)
exercises.description: Sustained hill efforts for mental and physical toughness
exercises.instructions: 10min easy warmup. Then 4 rounds of: 3min steady-hard effort uphill, walk/jog down for full recovery (4-5min). 5min cooldown.

conditions.knee_moderate: Use gradual gradient, monitor pain closely
conditions.hamstring_moderate: Focus on upright posture, don't overstride

exercises.hillGuidance: This is about sustainable power. Effort: 80-85% max. Gradient: 4-5%. Focus on rhythm and breathing. This is tough mentally!

exercises.name: Hill Progression Workout
exercises.instructions: 10min easy warmup. Then: 1min uphill hard, recover down, 2min uphill, recover, 3min uphill, recover, 2min uphill, recover, 1min uphill. 5min cooldown.

modifications.harder: Add a 4min interval at the peak

conditions.knee_moderate: Stay on gradual hills, take extra recovery between reps

exercises.hillGuidance: Start controlled on the 1min, save energy for the 3min effort. This teaches pacing on hills.

exercises.name: Rolling Hills Tempo
exercises.description: Continuous tempo effort on hilly terrain
exercises.instructions: 10min flat easy warmup. Then 20min tempo effort on rolling hills - maintain effort (not pace) throughout. Push the uphills, control the downhills. 5min flat cooldown.

conditions.knee_moderate: Focus on controlled downhill running, lean forward
conditions.calf_moderate: Stay on moderate gradients, avoid very steep climbs

exercises.hillGuidance: This simulates race conditions. Effort stays constant, pace varies. Don't hammer downhills - let gravity do the work.

exercises.name: Downhill Speed Intervals
exercises.description: Controlled downhill running for speed development and eccentric strength (ADVANCED)
exercises.instructions: 10min easy warmup. Find gradual downhill (2-4% grade). 6 x 90s fast but controlled downhill running, walk back up for recovery. 5min cooldown. CAUTION: Very demanding on quads.

conditions.quad_moderate: Not recommended - will cause severe DOMS

exercises.hillGuidance: IMPORTANT: Stay controlled, don't overstride. Lean forward slightly, quick cadence. This is for advanced runners only - causes significant muscle damage.
exercises.recoveryNote: Plan 2-3 days of easy running after this workout. Quads will be very sore.
